text: Glarus (German: ) is the capital of the Canton of Glarus in Switzerland. Glarus is on the Linth River. It is at the foot of the Gl√§rnisch foothills. == History == The first mention of the town is from 1178. It became the capital of the Linth valley in 1419. In the 1700s and 1800s, the valley began to be industrialized. In 1864, the first European labor law to protect workers was introduced in Glarus, prohibiting requiring workers to work more than 12 hours a day.
